name: Introduction to Film Studies
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of film studies, such as film history, theory, and analysis. Students will learn how to interpret films from a variety of perspectives, including technical, aesthetic, and cultural.

name: Digital Media Production
description: This course provides an introduction to the technical aspects of digital media production, such as sound production and design, video production, editing, and motion graphics. Students will learn the fundamentals of creating digital media projects, such as filmmaking, web design, and animation.

name: Advanced Digital Media Production
description: This course builds on the concepts learned in Digital Media Production, focusing on more advanced topics such as sound mixing, video editing, motion graphics, and visual effects. Students will gain an in-depth understanding of the technical aspects of digital media production.

name: Digital Media Theory and Analysis
description: This course introduces students to the theory and analysis of digital media, including theories of representation, narration, and genre. Students will gain an understanding of how digital media can be used to communicate messages and ideas.

name: Advanced Digital Media Theory and Analysis
description: This course builds on the concepts learned in Digital Media Theory and Analysis, focusing on more advanced topics such as transmedia storytelling and the intersection of digital media and technology. Students will gain an in-depth understanding of the theoretical aspects of digital media.
